snippet: For the first time in 17 years, "G.M.A." last week defeated "Today" not only in total viewers, but also among viewers between the ages of 25 and 54. Lucky for "Today," the Olympics will increase its viewership.
abstract: For the first time in 17 years, "G.M.A." last week defeated "Today" not only in total viewers, but also among viewers between the ages of 25 and 54. Lucky for "Today," the Olympics will increase its viewership.

headline.main: Just Before Olympics, 'Good Morning America' Takes Crown Away From 'Today'
